oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WNOX Broadcast
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jr. High School Aud[itorium]. Sat. Sept. 5 (no year). Broadcasting over WNOX, Knoxville, Tenn. Lists performers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Ephemera; Radio broadcasting; Musicians;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jr. HIGH SCHOOL Aud. SAT. SEPT. 5th 8 P.M. Admission 20c 35c Tax Included Spon. By American Post No. 11 BROADCASTING OVER WNOX KNOXVILLE. TENN: Every Week Day on the Mid-Day Merry-Go-Bound and 7:05 A. M. In Person Johnnie Wright On The Stage AND HIS TENNESSEE HILLBILLIES JACK ANGLIN, Master Ceremonies FEATURING THE HILLBILLY SENSATION EMORY MARTIN RAIDOS (sic.) ONLY ONE-ARM BANJO PLAYER Noting the Five String Banjo with His Teeth and Teas JOHNNIE and JACK Your Favorite Radio Singers Writers of some of your favorite songs, such as "I Died for the Red, White and Blue" "As Long as I Live" "Down Where the River Bends""Beyond the Morning Star" "Dying a Sinners Death" "My Only Home" and many others; singing the songs you like to hear, the way you like to hear them. "Cousin Elmer" The Funny Boy From the Country The Biggest Show of the Year. Bring 6ran'-maw and Gran'-paw and all the Kiddies for a Big Evening of Clean Fun, Singing and Music.
